hierarchy.colleague: We worked together on the same team

profile.title: Profile
profile.body:
Front-End Web developer with 15+ years of experience building scalable, high-performance, and responsive web applications. Specialized in Vue 3, Quasar framework, Nuxt 4 and Tailwind CSS/ Bootstrap to develop modern UI systems for enterprise, e-commerce, and SaaS platforms. Skilled in modular front-end architecture, atomic design systems, and cross-functional collaboration with design and backend teams.

Demonstrated success in improving web performance, reducing technical debt, and optimizing developer workflows using modern frameworks, reusable components, and CI/CD pipelines.

coreCompetencies.title: Core Competencies
coreCompetencies.body: Front-End Development • Vue.js 2/3 • Nuxt 3/4 • Tailwind CSS • Tailwind variants • Bootstrap • Vuetify • TypeScript • JavaScript (ES6+) • Responsive Web Design (RWD) • UI Implementation • Component Libraries • Atomic Design • SOLID principles • Agile Methodologies • RESTful APIs • Figma • Git • Unit Testing • Cypress • Vitest • Playwright • Vite • Vue Query • Axios • Sass • Less • Stylus • Html • Mjml • Email templates • Twig • AWS/S3 • Lighthouse • Swagger • Jira • Scrum and agile methodologies

positions.position: Front-End Developer (Vue.js / Nuxt / Quasar framework / Tailwind / Reka UI)
description: Engineered a shared modular architecture with Nuxt Layers and Vue Query, enabling 3 enterprise web apps to share over 70% of UI code, accelerating release cycles by 40%
Built and maintained a scalable Atomic Design system with 100+ reusable Vue 3 components, enhancing design consistency and reducing rework across product teams
Optimized UI performance through lazy loading, code-splitting, and Tailwind variants, resulting in Lighthouse scores above 90 and faster user interactions
Collaborated with designers and backend engineers to align UX/UI goals with business requirements, improving time-to-market and overall development efficiency
Elevated accessibility and responsiveness across platforms, ensuring pixel-perfect mobile and desktop experiences for brands like Transavia, OUIGO, and Royal Air Maroc
Responsive Email templates development with Mjml, Node, Litmus, Testi and Amazon SES for email delivery
Integration with AWS S3 for file storage and delivery
positions.techStack: Vue 3 • Nuxt 4 • Nuxt Layers • Quasar • Tailwind CSS • Tailwind Variants • Sass • Reka UI • TypeScript • Vue Query • Axios • Vite • i18n • mjml • AWS/S3 • Zod • Swagger • Postman • RESTful APIs • Responsive Design • Git • Figma • Jira • Scrum and agile methodologies

description: Modernized the front-end architecture for miumiu.com and prada.com, migrating from Vue 2 to Vue 3 and improving maintainability and scalability
Enhanced performance by optimizing routing and asset delivery, reducing load times by 25% and improving SEO scores across mobile and desktop
Reverse-engineered legacy code to produce detailed documentation, supporting faster onboarding for new developers and smoother maintenance cycles
Partnered with product and design teams to ensure flawless component delivery aligned with Figma specifications and accessibility standards
positions.techStack: Vue 2 • Vue 3 • Vuex • Webpack • i18n • JavaScript (ES6+) • Jira • Figma

der-gruene-punkt.name: Der Grüne Punkt – Duales System Deutschland GmbH

description: Developed the NV1RO Dashboard, a real-time analytics platform for sustainability data, improving operational visibility for internal users
Implemented responsive UI frameworks that boosted usability and accessibility by 35%, validated through end-user testing
Integrated AWS-based CI/CD pipelines and automated deployments, reducing release errors and deployment time by 20%
Strengthened code reliability by introducing Jest and Vue Test Utils, cutting regression incidents by 25% across sprints
positions.techStack: Vue 3 • Vite • Pinia • Bootstrap Vue • Bootstrap 5 • Sass • HTML5 • ES6+ • AWS S3 • Python • DynamoDB • AWS Lambda • Jest • Vue Test Utils • Vitest • Agile • Kanban

description: Delivered a multi-tenant back-office platform serving 10+ B2B clients, using Vue.js, Vuetify, and Quasar for modular, maintainable interfaces
Implemented an I18n localization architecture that reduced translation update times by 50%, improving international rollout speed
Streamlined project setup through optimized Webpack configurations and Vue CLI, decreasing build times and simplifying environment management
Partnered with UX designers to enhance user journeys, increasing engagement and feature adoption across client platforms
positions.techStack: Vue.js • Vuex • VuePersist • Vuetify • Quasar • VueMaterial • Webpack • Vue CLI • i18n • Sass • Swagger • Postman • RESTful APIs • Responsive Design • Git • Figma • Sketch • Jira

description: Built and maintained multiple B2B ecommerce sites (Point.P, SFIC, Brossette, Décocéram, Asturienne) using Vue.js and responsive design principles
Automated build and deployment pipelines with Gulp and Git, reducing manual errors by 40% and improving release reliability
Integrated RESTful APIs and collaborated with cross-functional teams under Agile frameworks to ensure high-quality, on-time feature delivery
Elevated front-end consistency and maintainability across brands by implementing a unified component structure and CSS methodology
positions.techStack: Vue.js • VueMaterial • HTML5 • Sass • CSS3 • JavaScript (ES6+) • RESTful APIs • Gulp • Webpack • Git • Jira • Swagger • Postman • Service Workers • PWA • Responsive Web Design

description: Mobile responsive web design for "1000km à cheval" site for Equidia group (www.1000kmacheval.fr)
Tech stack: HTML5, CSS3, NPM, Gulp, jQuery, JSON, AJAX, Responsive Design, Git, Twig, Symfony 2
Agile/Kanban methodology with Trello

items.title: E-commerce Platform
items.description: A full-stack e-commerce platform built with Vue 3, Nuxt 4, and Tailwind CSS. Features include user authentication, product catalog, shopping cart, payment integration, and admin dashboard.
items.techStack: Vue 3 • Nuxt 4 • Tailwind CSS • TypeScript • Pinia • Vite • Stripe API • RESTful APIs

items.title: Task Management App
items.description: A collaborative task management application with real-time updates, drag-and-drop functionality, and team collaboration features. Built using modern frontend technologies.
items.techStack: Vue 3 • Quasar Framework • TypeScript • Vue Query • WebSocket • Vite • i18n

items.jobPosition: Talent Acquisition Lead at Intelligenz IT | MBA in HR
items.postComment: I had the pleasure of hiring chechu on a Vuejs project, and client was thoroughly impressed with his skills and work ethic. Chechu Castro consistently demonstrated a strong ability to understand complex requirements and deliver high-quality results within tight deadlines. He also showed a willingness to collaborate with team members and communicate effectively to ensure project success. I highly recommend Chechu Castro for any frontend Vuejs role and believe that he would make a valuable addition to any team. He is very professional, reliable, and have a great work ethic that makes everyone a pleasure to work with Chechu. :) :)

items.jobPosition: Senior AWS Data Engineer - Big Data Engineer - Python developer - Cloud Solutions Engineer
items.postComment: I've worked with Chechu on a very interesting project- building a new web application from scratch. It was a very good experience tackling all the challenges we had with him. Even that we worked from a distance the communication was easy and discussing problems was always effective. Overall I really enjoyed working with Chechu.

items.jobPosition: Senior AWS Data Engineer / Backend Developer
items.postComment: I highly recommend Chechu as a Vue developer. During our time working together, I was consistently impressed by his technical skills and ability to deliver high-quality code. Additionally, he is an excellent colleague and team player, making him a pleasure to work with. I have no doubt that Chechu would be a great asset to any team looking for a skilled developer.

items.jobPosition: Technical Project Manager at Saint-Gobain Distribution Bâtiment France
items.postComment: I had the opportunity to work with Chechu for over 2 years. Ambitious, dynamic, and helpful, he managed to create great dynamism in my team both professionally and personally. It was a pleasure to challenge him technically because he is always ready to give his best. With Chechu, we never get bored. If you have interesting projects, try to meet him and you'll see for yourself :)

Chechu is a good developer who has the advantage of being versatile and autonomous. I had the pleasure of working with him for 3 years at St Gobain and we collaborated on several large-scale projects. (Decoceram, Asturienne, etc.) Chechu fulfilled his role perfectly and was always effective in his "Front" role. I also appreciate his character, someone kind, open, involved, and responsible, who doesn't hesitate to offer help to other team members. Any employer would be happy to have Chechu on their team ;)

items.jobPosition: Lead Frontend Engineer | Currently attending Executive Education in Full Stack Software Development – The University of Texas at Austin (McCombs School of Business)
items.postComment: Having Chechu on your team is a real asset. Dynamic and passionate, he knows how to share both his quality experience and his good mood. It's a real pleasure!

Chechu is a dynamic and jovial man, capable of motivating the people who work around him. Under my supervision, he managed to successfully complete all the projects I assigned to him, with competence and good humor. He has real and proven skills in the field of digital ergonomics, and his technical skills in jQuery, Zepto, Grunt, etc. no longer need to be demonstrated. He was also able to understand, as a Scrum Master, Agile methodologies and successfully implement them in the team he was responsible for (5 people). To summarize, he was a pleasant, available, motivated, competent, and always proactive collaborator.

items.jobPosition: Senior Software Engineer / Coinbase - Ex FE/UX/UI Engineer at Kraken, Nutanix, Transient Labs, DevRev
items.postComment: Chechu arrived at E-Merchant in a context where it was not easy to integrate, both from a purely technical point of view and on the human/organizational level. Nevertheless, he quickly adapted to the team structure and different projects as well as to the work processes, and was able to make the right technical decisions on new projects and manage the team as best as possible despite turnover. Chechu is therefore someone who knows how to handle pressure and assert himself on delicate decisions, while remaining humble and close to the people he manages.

Chechu is an excellent manager, I learned a lot by his side. He has the ability to motivate his team and shows a lot of attention to everyone, which gives the desire to go further and improve. Few are the leaders who show confidence in the members of their team and he is one of them.

items.jobPosition: Web Integrator at Groupe Profession Santé
items.postComment: I have the opportunity to work with Chechu at E-Merchant. He is my team leader and as such he supervises my work, accompanies me in my tasks and is available to help me when I encounter problems. He is the one who organizes the team's work and makes choices about technologies and working methods. On a daily basis, he is very pleasant, patient, pedagogical, and very invested in his work.
Chechu is someone very professional, who invests himself in his different projects. He has managed to evolve alongside the profession. Moreover, he has excellent relationships with teams.

It's pleasant to work with Chechu. His ability to determine priorities and the real needs of a task allows the team to work with cohesion in a good atmosphere. Whether on a technical, design, or development level, Chechu's level is that of a confirmed Lead.

items.jobPosition: I play with LLMs before they run over me (ex-Microsoft, ex-Dior, ex-Chanel, ex-Accor)
items.postComment: Certainly one of the driving team. Chechu deals with ease large-scale projects. Very sociable and very cozy on a daily basis can often rely on his advice. The pleasure of meeting in a future collaboration.

items.jobPosition: I play with LLMs before they run over me (ex-Microsoft, ex-Dior, ex-Chanel, ex-Accor)
items.postComment: Pedagogical and invested in his work, Chechu brings significant experience to the team. He is someone to whom substantial projects are entrusted.

I had the opportunity to work with Chechu on projects at Accor and it was a good experience. Chechu is a good developer who has the advantage of being versatile and autonomous. In a group, he has the right foundations to lead a team and manage the various tasks assigned to him. I appreciate Chechu's character, he is someone kind, open, involved, responsible, who doesn't hesitate to offer his help even if it means sacrificing some of his time. I also appreciated the working atmosphere with Chechu, his very particular humor to relieve daily stress. In the end, I strongly recommend Chechu and I am sure he is the right person to count on even on the most complicated projects.
